@IndyK58 @br8veheart @Chalkarts @e_mcclee @thehill No. Not an official act just bc Prez does it. If you're right, Obama repeatedly violated Hatch Act by campaigning for political candidates. Campaigning isn't an official act.

@IndyK58 @br8veheart @Chalkarts @e_mcclee @thehill 227 is inapplicable:  no official act, not done solely on basis of partisan political affiliation. No crime. Thanks for playing the home version of the game!

@overfossilfuels @sjneedsanap @StellaNandia @CathyGlaesman @Dinamico_7 @thehill Maybe he diverges from the norm.Maybe we don't know NASCAR fans at all & we have something to learn.Maybe he's lying? NO! Forget I said that

@JoshWKemp1 @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill There is an exception: Section 7 of the NLRA gives employees the right to discuss wages hours and working conditions and organizing a union.

@coloradooldlady @JoshWKemp1 @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill You are talking about the equivalent of prior restraint, not the right to speak. Content of the speech is the responsibility of the speaker.
@JoshWKemp1 @neutronneedle @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill The only law you need to refer to is the Constitution.
@neutronneedle @JoshWKemp1 @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill I'm in IT. Should free speech be protected when it is factually incorrect. Don't need no mansplaining.

@thehill 1. No one is protesting the national anthem, read up if you dont know what its about.

2. Do you know how many PoC have been NASCAR drivers?
@thehill I hope nascar tries to fire someone. I'd watch that lawsuit from beginning to end with a smile.

@thehill Hey NFL NBA LOOK NASCAR SEEMS TO BE MADE OF TRUE AMERICANS!!
@hrod_626 @WallaceRitchie @thehill Yes, incredible irony!  It is in reality the flag of traitors who wanted to overthrow the USA and failed.  Freedom of speech protects it.

@JoshWKemp1 @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill Wow, that's rough man.
@neutronneedle @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill Will jump back on tomorrow, I have to go take care of my father, stage 4 cancer. Long night ahead. Appreciate the civil dialogue.
@JoshWKemp1 @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill The first page has hits on both sides.
@JoshWKemp1 @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill Ask Google about: free speech protected at work
@JoshWKemp1 @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill Being required to lie to customers or subordinates comes to mind. more to come ...
@neutronneedle @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill Really the only laws I can find that protects certain free speech is about religion in the private sector.
@neutronneedle @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill Good question, I probably will have to sit and think awhile on that. Do you have any suggestions? I would research them if so.
@JoshWKemp1 @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill My queztion is the reverse. What speech related firing reason would lose in court?
@neutronneedle @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill I mean people get fired all them time for FB, and Twitter posts. I guess it would be up to the business owner.
@thehill Gotta appeal to your target audience https://t.co/nbptU1gsAj
@JoshWKemp1 @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill Right, but are there no limits? What would be unreasonable, constitutionally speaking, speech demands by a business?

@JoshWKemp1 @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill Absolutely. Gov't far more able to ruin lives. Still, should business have carte blanche? Dress codes (suits?), not even close to question.

@neutronneedle @coloradooldlady @swedegirl67 @MiaRN1042 @thehill When working for a private company you don't have complete right to freedom of speech. Especially when you signed a CBA, and contracts.
